item.title: 南非财政部长提醒不要仓促制定新的通胀目标
item.description: 南非财政部长表示，降低通胀目标的工作 "进展顺利"，但告诫不要仓促做出决定。【原文：South Africa’s finance minister said work on lowering the inflation target is “progressing well” but cautioned against rushing the decision.】

item.title: PitchBook 称风险投资支持的公司将迎来十年来最少的美国 IPO
item.description: 据数据提供商 PitchBook 称，风险投资支持的公司有望成为十年来美国首次公开募股数量最少的公司，尽管股市创下历史新高，但撤资总数仍在继续攀升。【原文：Venture capital-backed companies are on track for the fewest US initial public offerings in a decade, according to data provider PitchBook, even as stock markets hit records and the overall number of divestments continues to climb.】

item.title: 华尔街对财政部重建库房计划的担忧有所缓解
item.description: 在国会提高法定债务限额后，财政部补充现金缓冲的计划目前不太可能扰乱资金市场。【原文：The Treasury’s plan to replenish its cash buffer after Congress raised the statutory debt limit is unlikely to roil funding markets for now.】

item.title: 信贷基金崩溃导致 EY 遭受 10 亿美元诉讼
item.description: Bridging Finance Inc. 的接管人正在起诉 Ernst & Young LLP，索赔 14 亿加元（10 亿美元），称该审计师未能发现导致这家多伦多私人贷款公司倒闭的欺诈和错报。【原文：Bridging Finance Inc.’s receiver is suing Ernst & Young LLP for C$1.4 billion ($1 billion), alleging the auditor failed to detect fraud and misstatements that contributed to the Toronto private lender’s collapse.】

item.title: 银行卡余额下降导致美国消费者债务增速放缓
item.description: 由于信用卡和其他未偿循环债务的回落，5 月份美国消费者借贷增长速度为三个月来最慢。【原文：US consumer borrowing increased in May at the slowest pace in three months on a pullback in credit card and other revolving debt outstanding.】

item.title: 肯沃斯、彼得比尔特制造商在魁北克裁员以应对市场疲软
item.description: 据 Unifor 当地工会发布的消息称，由于需求疲软，肯沃斯（Kenworth）和彼得比尔特（Peterbilt）品牌的母公司、卡车制造商 PACCAR 公司将在其位于魁北克省圣特里斯（Sainte-Therese）的工厂裁员 175 人。【原文：Truck maker PACCAR Inc., parent company of the Kenworth and Peterbilt nameplates, will lay off 175 employees in its Sainte-Therese, Que.-plant over weakening demand, according to a news release sent by a local union of Unifor.】

item.title: Meta 向全球最大眼镜制造商投资 35 亿美元，推动人工智能眼镜发展
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Meta Plaforms 公司收购了全球最大的眼镜制造商 EssilorLuxottica SA 公司的少数股份。【原文：Meta Plaforms Inc. bought a minority stake in the world’s largest eye-wear maker EssilorLuxottica SA, a deal that increases the US tech giant’s financial commitment to the fast-growing smart glasses industry, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Fair Isaac 下跌，因为 Pulte 允许房利美和房地美使用 VantageScore
item.description: 在联邦监管机构表示政府资助的抵押贷款实体房利美（Fannie Mae）和房地美（Freddie Mac）将可以在确定借款人信用时使用第二家公司后，Fair Isaac Corp.【原文：Shares in Fair Isaac Corp., known colloquially as FICO, headed for the worst slide since March 2020 after federal regulators said government-sponsored mortgage entities Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac will be able to use a second firm when determining borrowers’ creditworthiness.】

item.title: 南非模拟美国提议的 30% 关税对预算的影响
item.description: 南非国家财政部担心美国提议的 30% 关税会打击税收，并正在模拟其对国家预算可能产生的影响。【原文：South Africa’s National Treasury is worried that the US’s proposed 30% tariff could hit tax revenues and is modeling the impact it may have on the nation’s budget.】

item.title: 米莱支持率保持不变，阿根廷人更担心就业问题
item.description: 今年 6 月，哈维尔-米莱伊总统的支持率和正面形象仍远高于国内同行，即使阿根廷人在今年早些时候失业率上升后对就业市场的担忧与日俱增。【原文：President Javier Milei’s approval rating and positive image remained well above domestic peers in June even as Argentines became increasingly worried about the job market after unemployment rose earlier this year.】

item.title: 欧盟考虑在下一份预算提案中为乌克兰提供 1,000 亿欧元基金
item.description: 由于乌克兰与俄罗斯的战争在莫斯科全面入侵后仍无结束迹象，欧盟正在考虑设立一个1000亿欧元（约合1 170亿美元）的基金来支持乌克兰。【原文：The European Union is considering setting up a €100 billion ($117 billion) fund to support Ukraine as its war with Russia following Moscow’s full-scale invasion shows no signs of ending.】

item.title: 马克龙在访问英国时推动斯塔默承认巴勒斯坦
item.description: 法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙在英国议会发表讲话，敦促英国承认巴勒斯坦国，并强调在中东紧张局势和美国支持不确定的情况下合作的必要性。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron urged the UK to recognize the state of Palestine in an address to the British parliament that emphasized the need for cooperation amid Middle East tensions and uncertainty over US support.】

item.title: 与墨西哥的番茄之争将使美国番茄价格上涨近 10
item.description: 由于与墨西哥长达数十年的协议将在不到一周的时间内到期，如果不在最后一刻达成协议或延期，消费者可能很快就要为新鲜番茄支付更高的价格。【原文：Consumers may soon be paying more for fresh tomatoes as a decades-long deal with Mexico expires in less than a week, absent a last-minute deal or extension.】

item.title: 特朗普呼吁征收 50%关税后，Comex 铜价飙升至创纪录水平
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示计划对进口金属征收 50%的关税后，Comex 期铜暴涨 17%。【原文：Copper futures on the Comex surged as much as 17% after US President Donald Trump said he planned to implement a 50% tariff on imports of the metal.】

item.title: 武伊契奇告诉《德国商报》，欧洲央行不应匆忙采取进一步的利率措施
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员鲍里斯-武伊契奇（Boris Vujcic）对《德国商报》说，欧洲中央银行不必过于担心通胀率暂时低于 2% 的目标，也不应急于采取进一步的利率举措。【原文：The European Central Bank mustn’t be too concerned about a temporary undershooting of the 2% inflation target and shouldn’t rush further interest-rate moves, Governing Council member Boris Vujcic told Handelsblatt.】

item.title: 特朗普称将对铜征收 50%的关税，对药品征税则要等一年
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统表示，他计划对铜征收 50%的税率，作为即将实施的一系列行业关税的一部分，同时他还表示，他可以在对外国制造的产品征税前至少给制药商一年的时间。【原文：President Donald Trump said he planned to implement a 50% rate on copper as part of a set of looming sectoral tariffs, while also indicating he could offer pharmaceutical manufacturers at least a year before implementing levies on their foreign-made products.】

item.title: Mistral 正与 MGX 等洽谈融资事宜，融资额最高达 10 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，法国人工智能初创公司 Mistral AI 正在洽谈从包括阿布扎比基金 MGX 在内的几家投资者处筹集多达 10 亿美元的资金。【原文：French artificial intelligence startup Mistral AI is in talks to raise as much as $1 billion in equity from several investors including Abu Dhabi fund MGX, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Waymo 从凤凰城开始提供青少年账户
item.description: Alphabet Inc.旗下的Waymo公司正在推出一种新的账户类型，让青少年可以叫到一辆机器人出租车并独自乘坐，从而扩大其乘客基础，同时继续在更多的美国城市测试其服务。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Waymo is launching a new account type that lets teenagers hail a robotaxi and ride alone, expanding its rider base while continuing to test its service in more US cities.】

item.title: Waymo 测试让纽约市离自动驾驶出租车更近一步
item.description: 本周，Waymo 的首批自动驾驶出租车抵达纽约市，开始在有人驾驶的情况下收集数据，因为该公司正在申请自动驾驶测试许可。【原文：Waymo’s first self-driving taxis arrived in New York City this week to begin collecting data with a human behind the wheel as the company seeks a permit for autonomous testing.】

item.title: 高盛为格雷传媒发行 7.5 亿美元垃圾债券
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，高盛集团计划于周一为广播公司格雷传媒公司出售 7.5 亿美元的垃圾债券。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is planning to sell a $750 million junk bond on Monday for broadcaster Gray Media Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 陷入困境的英国林赛炼油厂尚未重启燃料供应
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的人士透露，英国陷入困境的林赛炼油厂尚未重新开始向批发商交付燃料。【原文：The UK’s beleaguered Lindsey oil refinery has yet to restart fuel delivery to wholesalers, according to two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 法国部长担心股息税规则变更后股票交易流向英国
item.description: 法国财政部长说，如果他不向银行明确说明新股息税规则的适用范围，他担心股票交易会 "大量涌向 "伦敦。【原文：France’s finance minister said he feared a “mass exodus” of equity trading to London if he hadn’t provided clarity to banks about the application of new dividend tax rules.】

item.title: 科威特财富基金出售 31 亿美元美国银行股份
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，科威特投资局在隔夜大宗交易中出售了 31 亿美元的美国银行股份。【原文：The Kuwait Investment Authority sold a $3.1 billion stake in Bank of America Corp. in an overnight block trade, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普称若国会误导鲍威尔应 "立即辞职
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统说，如果批评者指控美联储主席在央行总部装修问题上误导立法者的指控属实，杰罗姆-鲍威尔应该 "立即辞职"。【原文：President Donald Trump said Jerome Powell should “resign immediately” if allegations from critics that the Federal Reserve chairman misled lawmakers about renovations at the central bank’s headquarters proved true.】

item.title: 作为裁员计划的一部分，英特尔在俄勒冈州裁员 500 多人
item.description: 作为裁员计划的一部分，英特尔公司将在俄勒冈州裁员 500 多人，预计最终将影响该芯片制造商约 20% 的员工。【原文：Intel Corp. is cutting more than 500 workers in Oregon as part of a layoff plan that’s ultimately expected to affect roughly 20% of the chipmaker’s staff.】

item.title: 欧盟将在美国贸易协议中保护空中客车公司，法拉利将蒙受损失
item.description: 在欧盟即将与美国达成贸易协议之际，其谈判代表正集中精力保护关键产业免受大规模关税的影响，这些关税最快将于 8 月 1 日对该集团的出口产品造成冲击。【原文：As the European Union nears a trade deal with the US, its negotiators are focusing on protecting key industries from massive tariffs set to hit the bloc’s exports as soon as Aug. 1.】

item.title: 钻井停滞不前，美国下调 2025 年原油产量增长预测
item.description: 由于油价波动限制了钻探活动，今年美国国内原油产量的增长速度将比预期更慢。【原文：The US sees domestic crude output growth slowing more than expected this year as choppy oil prices limit drilling activity.】

item.title: 由名人支持的素食皮革初创公司将进军芒尼市场，测试风险胃口
item.description: 本周，一家素食皮革初创公司将进入市政债券市场，这标志着投资者对投机性项目融资信心的一次考验。【原文：A vegan-leather start up is slated to tap the municipal bond market this week, marking a test of investor confidence in speculative project finance.】

item.title: BDLI 称，法德裂痕有可能导致下一代战斗机停产
item.description: 德国航空游说团体表示，法国和德国公司在下一代战斗机控制权问题上出现裂痕，有可能导致该项目失败。【原文：A rift between French and German companies over control of a next-generation fighter jet risks dooming the project, Germany’s aviation lobby said, putting in doubt a marquee program just as the region fortifies its defense capabilities.】

item.title: 美国银行上调 S&P 500 指数目标，看好美国企业的恢复能力
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp. ）的策略师上调了对美国股市的展望，理由是面对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统混乱的贸易政策，美国企业有能力维持盈利指导。【原文：Bank of America Corp. strategists boosted their outlook for US equities, citing the Corporate America’s ability to maintain earnings guidance in the face of President Donald Trump’s chaotic trade policies.】
